attributes.action: pressure the Japanese Government to apologise to the Australians for the sinking of the Centaur
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The Centaur, an Australian World War II hospital ship, was torpedoed and sunk by a Japanese submarine off North Stradbroke Island, Queensland, on the 14th of May 1943. 268 lost their lives. The attack against one of our greatest allies, by the submarine, I-177, resulted in public outrage as it was considered to be a war crime. Paul Lucas, the acting premier of Queensland, has described it as barbaric and senseless.
